page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: Block 04520159 is mainly agricultural land in a level valley between the Hampshire Downs, south of Kingsclere and the land rising north of Ashford Hill. It is drained by a stream running into the River Enborne and much of it was once destined to be flooded to form a resevoir - a plan fortunately abandoned. The fields are mainly grass and arable and there are several large mixed woods. One or two areas of unimproved pasture are botanically rich with wild daffodils in the spring and wild orchids in summer. Corn marigold survives in some of the corn fields and the woods contain primroses , wood anemones , solomons seal and bluebells.
